(Why not, it's a fun story, and there's just something's that would be grea=
t to role play...)

::CyberShark::

    The recent battles and Battera's wo=
und had all taken his toll on him, but the news that Battera was under some=
one's control just made him give out.
    He was so tired he couldn't keep =
awake, he jacked into the CR Chamber and programmed it to heal as fast as i=
t could, he didn't really want to miss anything, it might be disastrous.
  =
  After that was done his Optics returned to the normal blue and he shut th=
em, he fell asleep quickly after. He wouldn't be awake until he was complet=
ely healed.
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: logomorph@... 
=
  To: nbwrpg@egroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, September 28, 2000 5:08 PM
  Su=
bject: Re: Proposition


  ::Feline::

  She watched Cybershark get into th=
e chamber.  She felt that someting 
  was very wrong.  But she wasn't sure =
what.  She usually listened to 
  her feline insticts.  She decided to wait=
 to see what would happen.  
  She then had the thought of installing the c=
hip in Cybershark, but he 
  would have to be unconsious for that to happen=
.  She got a smile on 
  her face as she opened her arm panel and activated=
 HotRod's chip.  
  She smiled and waited for him to come out of the chambe=
r.




  --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "David Torrey" <Dachande85@m...> wrote:=

  > (Well it looks as if CyberShark might have a new goal, he was 
  stand=
ing in the doorway to where Battera was.)
  > 
  > ::CyberShark::
  > 
  > =
    He saw that Battera hadn't even noticed him, and that she was 
  going =
down the hall, he had enough power for a minimal cloak, he 
  decided on th=
is (just so I don't mode) because she had never ignored 
  him before. He s=
lipped into cloak mode and followed her down the hall.
  >     As soon as s=
he stopped he stopped, he listened in on the 
  conversation and realized t=
hat something was terribly amiss here. 
  Battera was under some sort of mi=
nd control, he needed to confront 
  Feline, but his power wasn't up to par=
. Instead he walked a little 
  bit away, decloaked and started to the CR C=
hambers. (They are in the 
  same general area right? Hot Rod was in one, a=
nd they couldn't have 
  been opposite the ship, she needs to stay close, o=
r slip back in)
  >     He saw Feline after Battera had left.
  >     "I'm =
here for a recharge," He said. "Power levels kinda low, 
  and I've been ba=
nged up pretty bad."
  >     He set one for minimal heal, so he would still=
 be awake, and 
  hopped in, shut his Optics and healed.
  >   ----- Origin=
al Message ----- 
  >   From: logomorph@h... 
  >   To: nbwrpg@egroups.com =

  >   Sent: Thursday, September 28, 2000 4:51 PM
  >   Subject: Re: Propos=
ition
  > 
  > 
  >   (OK this has to take place before HotRod gets out of =
the CR)
  > 
  > 
  >   ::Feline::
  >   She got out of the CR chamber and =
walked to her work bench.  She 
  >   opened her left forarm panel and inst=
alled the small control 
  board 
  >   for her chips.  She had one in HotR=
od, one in Battera.  She had 
  only 
  >   one chip left to install.  She =
picked up the chip and put in her 
  arm 
  >   with the panel.  She then c=
losed her arm panel and smiled.  She 
  could 
  >   now control the other =
bots and not lose the controls.  She 
  started 
  >   working on a plan to=
 get HotRod and Battera over to Zardus.  She 
  knew 
  >   she had to crea=
te a diversion to get them all out and with 
  minimal 
  >   damage.  She =
didn't want to hand damaged goods over to Zardus.  
  She 
  >   opened her=
 link, "Battera, could you come to the lab please?"
  >   She smiled.
  > 
=
  >   Battera::
  >   She walked down the hall and to the lab,"Yes, you cal=
led for me?"
  > 
  >   Feline:: She opened her arm panel and activated the=
 ship inside 
  >   Battera.
  > 
  >   Battera::
  >   She felt a surge of=
 information flood her mind. She fell to the 
  round 
  >   shaking and th=
en stood up as the chip took control of her.  She 
  >   looked at Feline. =
"What is it that you want?" she said in a 
  rather 
  >   rough voice.
  >=
 
  >   Feline::
  >   She smiled and walked up close to Battera.  SHe whis=
pered into 
  >   Battera's ear,"I want you to go to the Allience base and =
tell 
  Zardus 
  >   that you now serve him and that I will be going back =
to the base 
  >   soon. You are to follow and obey Zardus now. Got it?"
  =
> 
  >   Battera::
  >   She smiled evilly and looked at Feline, "Yes, righ=
t away."
  >   She then walked out of the lab.  She headed to the entrance =
and 
  >   stepped outside of the base.  She transformed into her bat mode =

  and 
  >   took off towards the sky.  She had the distict feeling like s=
he 
  was 
  >   finally finding her place. 
  > 
  >   (The chip mostly ch=
anges the nature of the bot from maximal to 
  >   Predacon.  All personall=
ity chances from good natured to evil.  
  And 
  >   makes the bot prone t=
o obeying who ever installed the chip. But 
  it 
  >   doesn't make them s=
laves completely)
